Description: Yellow painted pottery reis shabti of Shedkhons, pure-priest of Amun with black detail: a short lappet-wig tied with a fillet, a modelled face; one arm is held across the chest in relief and holds a whip, the figure wears a triangular apron inscribed with a column of black painted hieroglyphs that extends to the separated feet with marked toes.
Condition: fair - damage to back of legs
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
